#summary Some things you should know to start development
#labels Phase-Implementation

= Prerequisities =

It is useful to have a target platform set before you start the development. That should contain a normal KNIME setup with distmatrix (from labs), jep installed.

Your IDE should have [http://findbugs.cs.umd.edu/eclipse FindBugs], [http://beust.com/eclipse TestNG], [http://dist.codehaus.org/groovy/distributions/update/ Groovy], Maven ([http://m2eclipse.sonatype.org/update/ Maven Integration for Eclipse (m2e)] or [http://q4e.googlecode.com/ IAM - Integration for Apache Maven (Q)]), [http://www.eclipse.org/buckminster/downloads.html Buckminster plugins] (*important to select only the proper SVN plugins*), *one* of SVN team providers ([http://www.polarion.com/products/svn/subversive.php?src=eclipseproject Subversive], or [http://subclipse.tigris.org/update_1.6.x Subclipse]) installed.

You need to set the {{{JAVA_HOME}}} variable in your Windows machine pointing to a JDK root folder (which has {{{xjc.exe}}} tool in its {{{bin}}} folder.).

 * [http://fisheye2.atlassian.com/browse/hits/ie.tcd.imm.hits.interop/trunk/ie.tcd.imm.hits.interop ie.tcd.imm.hits.interop] - interoperability with other projects, like HCDC

= Materialisation =
Download one of the CQueries from [http://hits.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/general/ this folder]. Resolve and materialize it. You should have a view of the necessary projects.
